thread.title: Mavs waiting on health as difficult West challenge looms
thread.title_full: Mavs waiting on health as difficult West challenge looms

author: SCHUYLER DIXON
title: Mavs waiting on health as difficult West challenge looms
text:
Tony Gutierrez Mavs waiting on health as difficult West challenge looms 
FILE - In this April 24, 2015, file photo, Dallas Mavericks' Dirk Nowitzki, of Germany, runs upcourt against the Houston Rockets during Game 3 in an NBA basketball first-round playoff series. Nowitzki and the Mavericks were jilted by DeAndre Jordan in free agency and are no’t sure when all their projected starters will play together for the first time in the difficult Western Conference. (AP Photo/Tony Gutierrez, File) Tony Gutierrez Mavs waiting on health as difficult West challenge looms 
FILE - In this April 2, 2015, file photo, Dallas Mavericks' Chandler Parsons gets up off the court after a hard fall during the second half of an NBA basketball game against the Houston Rockets in Dallas. Parsons had surgery shortly after the season on a right knee that kept him out of all but the opener in a five-game loss to Houston, his former team, in the first round of the playoffs. (AP Photo/Tony Gutierrez, File) LM Otero Mavs waiting on health as difficult West challenge looms 
Dallas Mavericks guard Justin Anderson (1) drives against Atlanta Hawks forward Mike Muscala (31) during the first half of an NBA preseason basketball game Friday, Oct. 16, 2015, in Dallas. (AP Photo/LM Otero) LM Otero Mavs waiting on health as difficult West challenge looms 
Dallas Mavericks guard J.J. Barea (5) takes the turnover against Atlanta Hawks forward Al Horford (15) as guard Justin Holiday (7) looks on during the first half of an NBA preseason basketball game Friday, Oct. 16, 2015, in Dallas. (AP Photo/LM Otero) Posted: Friday, October 16, 2015 11:44 pm | Updated: 1:01 am, Sat Oct 17, 2015. Mavs waiting on health as difficult West challenge looms Associated Press | 0 comments 
DALLAS (AP) — Dirk Nowitzki and the Mavericks were jilted by DeAndre Jordan in free agency and aren't sure when all their projected starters will play together for the first time in the difficult Western Conference. 
It's not exactly the formula Dallas wanted as it tries to win its first playoff series since the franchise's only championship in 2011. It also doesn't do anything to change the 37-year-old Nowitzki's expectations going into his 18th season. kAmQ%9:D 7C2?49:D6 2=H2JD AC:56D :ED6=7 :?
